main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in Dayton, Ohio, including the observation of three objects on 30 May 1954, and a report of a round object with a funny design descending in front of a car on 25 June 1954.
interesting points: Over 3,500 reports and 12,900 weather scores were collected for further study.
One sighting described a round object with a funny design that descended in front of a car, stopped, moved slowly to the right, stopped again, and then took off straight up into the air.
A witness at a drive-in theater recounted seeing a flat, round object that attracted attention but was not reported to avoid being seen as crazy.
The U.S. Air Force prepared a technical information sheet with a detailed questionnaire for gathering information about unidentified aerial phenomena sightings.
The witness described the object as 'straight as a beam, with a red hot flame out the rear,' and reported no sound associated with the object.
witnesses: civilian and multiple witnesses at different locations
